text: On July 27, 2022, very heavy rainfall hit parts of eastern Kentucky and southwest Virginia, including surrounding Appalachia communities. This cause large floodings in Kentucky. The flooding caused 25 deaths with many reportedly missing. On July 29, President Joe Biden said the flooding was a major disaster in Kentucky and ordered federal aid to help state and local recovery efforts in the areas affected. ==References== Category:July 2022 events Category:2022 floods Category:2020s in Kentucky Category:2022 disasters in the United States Category:August 2022 events Category:Floods in the United States
title: 2022 Eastern Kentucky floods
